unnormalised: Hey everyone, remember that sinking feeling when the lights flicker and die right in the middle of your favourite IPL match? Yep, that's load shedding hitting you like a badly timed bouncer from Bumrah. Load shedding, or planned power outages, is basically when the power company, usually the state electricity board (like MSEB in Maharashtra or BESCOM in Karnataka), deliberately cuts off electricity supply to certain areas. They do this to prevent the whole system from collapsing when demand is higher than the supply.
